summary: Reusable medical equipment (such as flexible, camera-bearing endoscopes) must be reprocessed between uses—that is, it must be cleaned, disinfected, or sterilized. The Veterans Health Administration has rules for such steps and oversees the process at VA medical centers. We testified that VHA did not have reprocessing inspection results for all its facilities, so it can't ensure that its medical centers are following its rules. VHA...
title: VA Health Care: Improvements in Oversight Needed for Reusable Medical Equipment
